_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM

JONES FRUIT & PRODUCE

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



A.    Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response 



Jones Fruit & Produce's accidental prevention policy involves a unified approach that integrates technologies, procedures and management practices. It is the policy of Jones Fruit & Produce to adhere to all applicable federal and state safety and environmental regulations.



Jones Fruit & Produce's emergency response policy involves the preparation of response plans and training of employees in evacuation and the handling of minor ammonia releases.



B.    Regulated Substance Handled at this Facility 



Jones Fruit & Produce is a cold storage facility located at 1955 F. Street Quincy Washington. The facility is located in Grant County. The main office is located at 831 A. Street SE Quincy Washington. 



The regulated substance used at Jones Fruit & Produce is Anhydrous Ammonia (CAS# 7664417). The use of Anhydrous Ammonia at this facility is for the purpose of refrigeration.



There are 12,278 pounds of Anhydrous Ammonia  in the refrigeration system. 



Jones Fruit & Produce has established policies, procedures and training to reduce the risk of an accidental hazardous substance release for the safety of its employees and the surrounding areas. 



1.    Industry standards and quality controls were followed in the design of this equipment and its manufacture.

2.    The facility insures only qualified personnel operate the system.

3.    The facility requires that all PSM elements as well as the company maintenance polices are followed.

4.    Only trained and authorized personnel have access to the system. 



C.    General Accidental Release Prevention Program 



Jones Fruit & Produce release prevention program is based on the following key elements:

1.    Prevention maintenance program 

2.    Written safety procedures and safety equipment 

3.    Use of accurate and effective written operating procedures 



The ammonia refrigeration system was installed

to applicable codes and good practices at the time installation. Piping is elevated to prevent accidental damage to the system from moving vehicles. Engine room doors are tight fitting and open outwards. Other safety devices Jones Fruit & Produce utilizes includes: 

1.    Computerized controls 

2.    High Discharge pressure shut-down 

3.    Low suction pressure shut-down

4.    Head water high discharge temperature shut-down

5.    Oil pressure plugged shut-down on the screw compressor 

6.    Oil filter plugged shut-down on the screw compressor 

7.     Check valves 

8.    250 psi relief valves on the high pressure side, vented to the atmosphere 

9.    150 psi relief valves on the low pressure side , vented to the atmosphere 

10.    Personal protective equipment (PPE) - Air purifying respirator, gloves and goggles



Operating procedures have been prepared by Jones Fruit & Produce for employees performing operational functions. The operation procedures are kept in the refrigeration supervisors office. The procedures include:

1.    Pre-start procedures 

2.    Routine operations 

3.    Maintenance 

4.    Response to minor releases 

5.    Emergency action plan



D.    Five Year Accidental History



Jones Fruit & Produce has not had any accidents involving ammonia in the last five years.



E.    Emergency Response Program 



In addition to the operating procedures, Jones Fruit & Produce has established Emergency Response Guidelines for release involving ammonia. These procedures are part of the ongoing training. 



F.    Planned Safety Improvements



None at this time.
